page.title: 07 SAINT GEORGES SCHOOL
page.content: SAINT GEORGES SCHOOL IS SITUATED NORTH OF THE A2 ON THE MAIN GRAVESEND-WROTHAM ROAD.THE SCHOOL WAS FOUNDED IN 1580.THIS SCHOOL WAS KNOWN AS THE GRAVESEND FREE SCHOOL.IN 1835 IT AMALGAMATED WITH THE NATIONAL SCHOOL.IN 1932 THE SITE OF THE COMBINED SCHOOL,LOCATED IN KINGS STREET,WAS SOLD.WITH SUPPLEMENTS FROM PUBLIC FUNDS THE PRESENT SITE WAS BOUGHT AND A COMPLEX OF BUILDINGS ERECTED.IN 1975 THE SCHOOL CHANGED TO A COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM OF EDUCTATION.DURING THE LAST DECADE THE SCHOOL EXPANDED.ON FRIDAY THE TENTH OF JULY 1985 THE BUILDING WAS OFFICIALLY OPENED AND BLESSED BY THE BISHOP OF ROCHESTER,DAVID SAY.THE CEREMONY WAS ATTENDED BY A LOCAL DIGNITARIES,INCLUDING THE MAYOR OF GRAVESHAM,FRANK GIBSON.THE SCHOOL CURRENTLY HAS A ROLL OF 1012 PUPILS AND 63 MEMBERS OF STAFF.
